other_tests.findings: Sinus tachycardia, low-voltage, low-anterior forces, flattened T waves, and a mildly prolonged QT interval.
Systolic ejection fraction was 52%, inferolateral and inferior hypokinesis detected. Both ventricles unusually thickened and edematous. A small pericardial effusion was seen.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Repeat echocardiogram showed deterioration, with severe global systolic dysfunction of the left ventricle and an ejection fraction of 24%. A later repeat echo showed recovery of left ventricular systolic function, with no signs of myocardial edema or hypokinesis.
